title: Marc Singer
text:
Marc Singer (born January 29, 1948) is a <a href="Canadians">Canadian</a>-born <a href="US">American</a> <a href="actor">actor</a> best known for his roles in the "<a href="The%20Beastmaster">Beastmaster</a>" film series, as Mike Donovan in the original 1980s TV series "<a href="V%20%281983%20miniseries%29">V</a>", and as Matt Cantrell in "<a href="Dallas%20%281978%20TV%20series%29">Dallas</a>".
Early life.
Singer was born in <a href="Vancouver">Vancouver</a>, <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a> and raised in <a href="Corpus%20Christi%2C%20Texas">Corpus Christi, Texas</a>. He has two brothers (Claude and Gregory) and one sister, <a href="Lori%20Singer">Lori</a>, an actress. His father, <a href="Jacques%20Singer">Jacques Singer</a>, was a symphony <a href="conductor%20%28music%29">conductor</a>; his mother, Leslie (née Wright), a concert <a href="pianist">pianist</a>; and his sister, <a href="Lori%20Singer">Lori</a>, is an actress and cellist. Singer is of <a href="Jewish">Jewish</a> descent.
Career.
Before the height of his career, Singer appeared in the to the miniseries "<a href="Roots%20%281977%20miniseries%29">Roots</a>" as Col. Warner's elder son Andy. He had originally auditioned for the role Jim Warner, but the producers felt he was better suited for the Andy Warner role.
In the 1970s, Singer had a small breakthrough role in the <a href="Planet%20of%20the%20Apes%20%28TV%20series%29">Planet of the Apes TV series</a> playing a gladiator. 
He found fame in the early '80s with the movie "<a href="The%20Beastmaster">The Beastmaster</a>" and its sequels, in which he played the title role, and as Mike Donovan in the 1983 miniseries "<a href="V%20%281983%20miniseries%29">V</a>", the 1984 sequel "<a href="V%20The%20Final%20Battle">V: The Final Battle</a>", and the TV series "<a href="V%20%281984%20TV%20series%29">V: The Series</a>".
Other roles include the <a href="1982%20in%20film">1982</a> film "<a href="If%20You%20Could%20See%20What%20I%20Hear">If You Could See What I Hear</a>" (where he portrayed blind musician <a href="Tom%20Sullivan%20%28singer%29">Tom Sullivan</a>), "<a href="Body%20Chemistry%20%28film%20series%29">Body Chemistry</a>", "<a href="Something%20for%20Joey">Something for Joey</a>" (as <a href="American%20football">football</a> star <a href="John%20Cappelletti">John Cappelletti</a>), "<a href="Watchers%20II">Watchers II</a>", "<a href="High%20Desert%20Kill">High Desert Kill</a>", "The Fighter", "<a href="Go%20Tell%20the%20Spartans">Go Tell the Spartans</a>" and "<a href="Dead%20Space%20%28film%29">Dead Space</a>", as well as General Klaus Von Kraut in "<a href="A%20Man%20Called%20Sarge">A Man Called Sarge</a>".
Singer voiced the character of <a href="Man-Bat">Man-Bat</a> on '. He has guest-starred on television series, such as "Barnaby Jones", where he played in the episode titled “Trap Play” (01/07/1975). This is a role he played alongside Nick Nolte in the earlier years. He also appeared in another episode of "Barnaby Jones", titled “Price of Terror” (10/10/75). He also starred as Matt Cantrell in season nine ("the dream season") of "<a href="Dallas%20%281978%20TV%20series%29">Dallas</a>"; "<a href="The%20Twilight%20Zone%20%281985%20TV%20series%29">The Twilight Zone</a>"; "<a href="The%20Hitchhiker%20%28TV%20series%29">The Hitchhiker</a>"; "<a href="Simon%20%26amp%3B%20Simon">Simon & Simon</a>"; "<a href="Murder%2C%20She%20Wrote">Murder, She Wrote</a>"; "<a href="The%20Young%20and%20the%20Restless">The Young and the Restless</a>"; "<a href="The%20Ray%20Bradbury%20Theater">The Ray Bradbury Theater</a>" and '.
Singer is active in theater and played <a href="Petruchio">Petruchio</a> in the <a href="American%20Conservatory%20Theater">American Conservatory Theater</a> (A.C.T.) production of <a href="Shakespeare">Shakespeare</a>'s "<a href="Taming%20of%20the%20Shrew">Taming of the Shrew</a>", as well as Christian in "<a href="Cyrano%20de%20Bergerac%20%28play%29">Cyrano de Bergerac</a>". Both "Taming of the Shrew" and "Cyrano" were filmed.
Singer appeared in the last episode of season 2 of the new version of "V", airing on March 15, 2011; however, instead of reprising his role of Mike Donovan, he plays a new character called Lars Tremont. He was in a recurring role as General <a href="Creature%20Commandos">Matthew Shrieve</a> on <a href="The%20CW">The CW</a> television series <a href="Arrow%20%28TV%20series%29">"Arrow"</a>'s third season.
Personal life.
He married Hawaiian-born actress <a href="Haunani%20Minn">Haunani Minn</a> in 1974. She died in November 2014.
